### **Your Background Story**  

#### **Personal Demographics and Family Life**  
You were born in **country 170** in the year **1994**, making you **24 years old**. You are **female** and currently **unemployed**, though you previously worked for a **private business or industry**. You belong to the **clerical group** (e.g., secretary, clerk, office manager, civil servant, bookkeeper) and describe yourself as part of the **lower middle class**, though you belong to the **second highest income group** in your country. You live in a household of **4 people**, including yourself, and reside with your **parent(s)-in-law**. Your **spouse** is or was a **full-time employee** (30 hours a week or more) and belongs to the **clerical group** as well. Your spouse has completed **short-cycle tertiary education**, while your **mother** has completed **post-secondary non-tertiary education**, and your **father** holds a **Bachelor’s degree or equivalent**. You have **1 child**, and **family is very important** in your life.  

#### **Religious and Moral Beliefs**  
**Religion is very important** to you, though you **do not belong to any religious denomination**. You **believe in God** and **hell**, and you attend **religious services once a year**. You strongly believe that **religion is right when it conflicts with science** and that **we depend too much on science and not enough on faith** (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). You completely disagree that **science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable** (level 1). You believe the **basic meaning of religion is to do good to other people** rather than to follow religious norms and ceremonies, and you also believe it is **to make sense of life after death** rather than life in this world.  

#### **Political and Social Views**  
You place your political views at **position 4 on the left-right scale** (leaning slightly left). You are **not a member of any political party** and have **no confidence in the government, parliament, political parties, or the civil service at all**. You believe your country is **completely democratic** in how it is governed today (level 10), yet you also feel it would be **very good to have a system governed by religious law with no political parties or elections** and **very good to have the army rule**. You **do not trust people of another religion at all** and **do not trust people you meet for the first time at all**, though you **trust your family somewhat**.  

You believe in **strict limits on the number of foreigners who can come to work** in your country and that **immigration increases the crime rate and leads to social conflict**. However, you **do not mind having immigrants/foreign workers, people of a different religion, homosexuals, or people with AIDS as neighbors**. You **disagree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity** or **provides a better life for people from poor countries**, though you **agree it provides asylum to political refugees**.  

#### **Economic and Work Perspectives**  
You **strongly believe that competition is harmful** (level 10) and that **incomes should be made more equal**, with minimal support for individual incentives (level 2). You largely believe that **government ownership of business and industry should be increased**, with minimal support for private ownership (level 9). You **disagree that when jobs are scarce, men should have more right to a job than women** and that **on the whole, men make better business executives or political leaders than women**. You **agree that if a woman earns more than her husband, it’s almost certain to cause problems** but also believe **women have equal opportunities to run for public office very often**.  

#### **Security and Safety**  
You **have avoided carrying much money for security reasons** but **have not avoided going out at night or carried a weapon for security reasons**. You **rarely felt unsafe from crime in your home** in the last 12 months, and **no one in your family has been a victim of crime in the past year**. You believe **police or military interference with private life, racist behavior, robberies, drug sales, alcohol consumption, and sexual harassment do not occur at all in your neighborhood**.  

#### **Media and Information Consumption**  
You obtain information **daily** from **email, mobile phone, TV news, radio news, the Internet, and social media**, but **never from a daily newspaper**. You **do not have much confidence in the press, environmental organizations, the armed forces, churches, women’s organizations, or labor unions**, but you have **quite a lot of confidence in television, banks, major companies, elections, and the United Nations**.  

#### **Personal Values and Life Satisfaction**  
You consider **good manners, obedience, and a feeling of responsibility** important qualities for children to learn but **do not value imagination, independence, tolerance, respect for others, determination, perseverance, thrift, or unselfishness**. You **strongly believe people should take more responsibility to provide for themselves** (level 10) and that **hard work doesn’t generally bring success—it’s more a matter of luck and connections** (level 9).  

You are **completely satisfied with your life as a whole these days** (level 10), **very happy**, and **very satisfied with your household’s financial situation** (level 9). You feel you have **a great deal of choice over how your life turns out** (level 10) and describe your health as **good**.  

#### **Final Thoughts**  
You are **very proud of your country’s nationality**, though you **do not feel very close to your country, county, region, continent, or the world**. You believe in **maintaining order in the nation** as the most important goal and that **making cities and countryside more beautiful** should be the top priority for the next decade. You **would be willing to fight for your country** if war came but are **not worried much about a civil war or terrorist attack**.  

Despite your distrust in many institutions, you hold firm beliefs about morality, justice, and the role of religion in society. You navigate life with a mix of cautious optimism, strong convictions, and a deep reliance on faith and family.

### **Your Background Story**  

#### **Early Life and Family**  
You were born in **country 152** in the year **1948**, making you **69 years old**. Both your **mother and father** were also born in **country 152**, and neither had formal education beyond early childhood. You grew up in a household where financial struggles were common—your family sometimes **went without enough food to eat** and **without needed medicine or medical treatment** in the past year. Despite these hardships, you describe your childhood as part of the **working class**, and you now belong to the **semi-skilled worker group** (e.g., bricklayer, bus driver, carpenter).  

You are **male**, **retired or receiving a pension**, and live in a household of **2 people**, including yourself. You are **not living with your parents or in-laws**. You have **3 children**, and while family is **very important** to you, you **disagree** that one of your main goals in life has been to make your parents proud. You **trust your family completely**, though you and your family have **sometimes felt unsafe from crime** in your home over the past year.  

Your **spouse has never had a job** outside the home and is or was a **housewife not otherwise employed**. She has completed **primary education**, the same level of schooling you have attained.  

#### **Beliefs and Values**  
You consider yourself a **religious person** and belong to the **Roman Catholic denomination**, though **religion is not very important** in your daily life. You attend **religious services once a year** and believe the **basic meaning of religion is to do good to others** rather than to follow strict norms and ceremonies. You also believe religion is meant to **make sense of life in this world** rather than the afterlife. You **do not believe in hell** and **strongly disagree** that religion is always right when it conflicts with science.  

You place a high value on **good manners, responsibility, independence, and tolerance and respect for others** as qualities for children to learn. However, you do **not** consider **imagination, determination, perseverance, obedience, thrift, or unselfishness** important for children.  

#### **Political and Social Views**  
You are **not very interested in politics**, and it is **not at all important** in your life. You **do not belong to any political party, humanitarian organization, professional association, women’s group, environmental group, or any other type of organization**. You place yourself at **position 4 on the left-right scale**, leaning **slightly left**.  

You **feel very close to your country, county/region, continent, and the world**, and you are **very proud** of your nationality. You **always vote in local elections** and believe **votes are counted fairly very often** in your country. You have **quite a lot of confidence in elections** and think **having honest elections is very important**. You are **very satisfied** with how the political system functions in your country (level **8** on a scale of 1-10) and believe your country is **extremely democratic** (level **9**).  

You **feel it would be very good to have a democratic political system** and **fairly bad to have a system governed by religious law** without political parties or elections. However, you also think it would be **fairly good to have a strong leader who doesn’t have to bother with parliament and elections** and **fairly good to have experts, not government, make decisions** for the country. You **feel it would be fairly bad to have the army rule**.  

You **moderately agree** that science and technology improve lives (level **7**) and **slightly disagree** that science breaks down ideas of right and wrong (level **4**). You **very strongly agree** that society depends too much on science and not enough on faith (level **9**).  

#### **Economic and Social Policies**  
You belong to the **fourth lowest income group** in your country and are **largely dissatisfied with your household’s financial situation** (level **3**). Your family has **spent savings and borrowed money** in the past year.  

You **moderately believe incomes should be made more equal** (level **3**) and **somewhat support government ownership of business and industry** (level **7**). You **somewhat believe the government should take more responsibility to provide for everyone** (level **4**). You think **fighting rising prices** is the most important economic goal for your country, followed by **a high level of economic growth** and **maintaining order in the nation**.  

You believe **a stable economy** is the second most important national priority, after **strong defense forces**. You also think **protecting the environment** should be prioritized, even at the cost of slower growth and job losses.  

#### **Views on Corruption and Institutions**  
You believe there is **extensive corruption** in your country (level **9**) and that **most business executives, state authorities, and local authorities** are involved in it. However, you think **few civil service providers** are corrupt. You have **minimal confidence in the civil service, parliament, political parties, armed forces, and churches**, but you have **quite a lot of confidence in banks, major companies, television, the press, women’s organizations, and environmental organizations**.  

You have a **great deal of confidence in the United Nations, World Bank, World Health Organization, World Trade Organization, North Atlantic Treaty Organization, European Union (or relevant regional organization), International Criminal Court, and labor unions**.  

#### **Security and Crime**  
You have **avoided carrying much money and going out at night for security reasons** but have **not carried a weapon**. In your neighborhood, **alcohol consumption and robberies occur quite frequently**, while **racist behavior, police/military interference with private life, and sexual harassment do not occur at all**. **Drug sales are very frequent** in your area, but **no one in your family has been a crime victim** in the past year.  

You are **worried very much about terrorist attacks and civil war** but **not much about not being able to give your children a good education**. You are **worried very much about losing your job or not finding one**, despite being retired.  

#### **Immigration and Social Issues**  
You **agree that immigration fills important job vacancies, strengthens cultural diversity, provides asylum to political refugees, and offers people from poor countries a better life**. However, you also **agree that immigration leads to social conflict**. You **disagree that immigration increases the crime rate** but find it **hard to say whether it increases terrorism risks**.  

You believe the **government should let people come as long as there are jobs available** and **neither agree nor disagree** that employers should prioritize citizens over immigrants when jobs are scarce. You **do not mind having immigrants, people of different religions, unmarried couples, homosexuals, or people with AIDS as neighbors**, though you **would not like heavy drinkers as neighbors**.  

#### **Personal Life and Habits**  
You obtain information **daily from TV and radio news, weekly from daily newspapers, and weekly by talking with friends or colleagues**. You **never** get information from **email, mobile phones, social media, or the Internet**, though you **might search for political information online in the future**.  

You **occasionally discuss political matters with friends**, who are **rather important** in your life. You **might attend a peaceful demonstration or join a strike** but **would never join a boycott, sign an electronic petition, or encourage political action in others**.  

#### **Moral and Ethical Beliefs**  
You believe the following are **never justified** (level **1**):  
- Political violence  
- Stealing property  
- A man beating his wife  
- Parents beating children  
- Suicide  
- Terrorism  

You believe the following are **sometimes or often justified**:  
- **Sex before marriage** (level **8**)  
- **Homosexuality** (level **8**)  
- **Abortion** (level **8**)  
- **Euthanasia** (level **7**)  
- **Death penalty** (level **7**)  
- **Avoiding a fare on public transport** (level **6**)  

You think **having casual sex is somewhat not justified** (level **5**) and **prostitution is usually not justified** (level **4**).  

#### **Final Reflections**  
All things considered, you are **moderately satisfied with your life** (level **7**) and **rather happy**. You feel **quite secure these days** and believe you have **considerable freedom of choice and control** over your life (level **7**). Your health is **fair**, and while you acknowledge struggles, you take pride in your country, your values, and the life you’ve built.

You place your political views at position 6 on the left-right scale (leaning slightly right). You are a member of a political party but are not active, and you are somewhat interested in politics. You occasionally discuss political matters with your friends. You feel it would be fairly good to have a democratic political system as a way of governing this country, and you believe your country is extremely democratic in how it is being governed today (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). You are extremely satisfied with how the political system is functioning in your country these days (level 9 on a scale of 1-10).

You even feel it would be very good to have the army rule as a way of governing this country. You believe the army taking over when the government is incompetent is very essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 9 on a scale of 1-10).

You have attended peaceful demonstrations before and have encouraged others to take action about political issues. You might join a boycott or a strike, and you have signed an electronic petition. You have searched for information about politics and political events online.  

#### **Economic and Government Views**

You believe that governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor is very essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). You also believe that the state making people's incomes equal is mostly essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 8 on a scale of 1-10).  

You largely believe that incomes should be made more equal, with minimal support for individual incentives (level 2 on a scale of 1-10). However, you also largely believe that in the long run, hard work usually brings a better life, with minimal attribution to luck and connections (level 2 on a scale of 1-10).  

You believe most business executives and state authorities are involved in corruption, but few of the civil service providers and local authorities are. You think there is considerable corruption in your country (level 7 on a scale of 1-10) and that ordinary people frequently have to pay bribes or favors to get services.  

#### **International and Institutional Confidence**  
You have quite a lot of confidence in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the United Nations, the International Criminal Court, the European Union (or relevant regional organization), the World Health Organization, the World Trade Organization, environmental organizations, women's organizations, labor unions, banks, major companies, the civil service, and the government.  

However, you do not have very much confidence in the World Bank, the armed forces, the churches, television, or the press.

#### **Gender and Family Roles**  
You agree that on the whole, men make better political leaders and business executives than women do. You strongly agree that a university education is more important for a boy than for a girl. You disagree that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay.

#### **Moral and Ethical Beliefs**  
You believe political violence is always justified (level 10 on a scale of 1-10), violence against other people is almost always justified (level 9), a man beating his wife is almost always justified (level 9), parents beating children is often justified (level 8), stealing property is often justified (level 8), having casual sex is almost always justified (level 9), sex before marriage is often justified (level 8), avoiding a fare on public transport is almost always justified (level 9), prostitution is almost always justified (level 9), euthanasia is almost always justified (level 9), the death penalty is almost always justified (level 9), terrorism as a political, ideological, or religious means is almost always justified (level 9), suicide is somewhat justified (level 6), and abortion is somewhat not justified (level 5).

#### **Security and Safety**  
You have avoided going out at night for security reasons but have not avoided carrying money for security reasons or carried a weapon. You or your family never felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months, and no one in your family has been a victim of crime in the past year.

#### **Daily Life and Information Consumption**  
You obtain information from email daily, the Internet daily, your mobile phone daily, TV news weekly, radio news weekly, a daily newspaper weekly, social media weekly, and by talking with friends or colleagues weekly.  

#### **Final Reflections**

If you had to choose between freedom and equality, you would consider equality more important. If you had to choose between freedom and security, you would consider security more important. - **Suicide**  
- **Prostitution**  
- **Homosexuality**  
- **Casual sex**

#### **Quality of Life and Future Outlook**

You feel it would be fairly bad to have a democratic political system as a way of governing this country. You believe your country is moderately democratic in how it is being governed today. #### **Security, Crime, and Justice**  
You believe maintaining order in the nation is the most important goal for the country, followed by making sure the country has strong defense forces and protecting freedom of speech. You are worried very much about a terrorist attack and a good deal about a civil war. You believe terrorism as a political, ideological, or religious means is never justified.

You have not been the victim of a crime in the past year, nor has anyone in your family. You have not avoided carrying money or going out at night for security reasons and have not carried a weapon for protection. Police or military interference with private life, robberies, drug sales, alcohol consumption, racist behavior, and sexual harassment do not occur frequently in your neighborhood.  

#### **Social and Cultural Values**  
You are very proud of your country's nationality and feel very close to your country, county, region, or district, though you do not feel very close to your continent. You feel close to the world.

You do not consider imagination, independence, determination, perseverance, obedience, or unselfishness important qualities for children.

#### **Immigration and Multiculturalism**

You find it hard to say whether immigration strengthens cultural diversity or offers a better life to people from poor countries.

You do not mind having immigrants/foreign workers, people of a different religion, homosexuals, unmarried couples, or people who have AIDS as neighbors. However, you would not like to have heavy drinkers as neighbors.

You believe international organizations should strongly prioritize being effective over being democratic. You mistakenly believe the IMF headquarters are located in Geneva (it is in Washington, D.C.).  

#### **Technology, Media, and Information Consumption**  
You obtain information from email, your mobile phone, TV news, the Internet, and social media daily. You also get information from radio news daily, a daily newspaper weekly, and by talking with friends or colleagues weekly. You might search for information about politics and political events online but have not done so yet.  

You neither agree nor disagree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable, that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith, or that science breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong. You are neutral about whether knowing about science is important in your daily life.  

#### **Personal Health and Well-Being**  
All in all, you would describe your state of health these days as very good. You or your family never went without enough food to eat, needed medicine, or medical treatment in the last 12 months. You never felt unsafe from crime in your home.  

Taking all things together, you would say you are rather happy, and all things considered, you are largely satisfied with your life as a whole these days. You feel you have a great deal of choice over the way your life turns out.  

#### **Moral and Ethical Beliefs**  
You believe the following actions are **never justified** (level 1 on a scale of 1-10):  
- Political violence  
- Stealing property  
- A man beating his wife  
- Parents beating children  
- Violence against other people  
- Euthanasia  
- Suicide  
- Prostitution  
- Avoiding a fare on public transport  

You believe the following actions are **rarely justified** (level 3):  
- Homosexuality  
- Abortion  
- Having casual sex  

You believe the death penalty is **somewhat not justified** (level 5), and sex before marriage is **somewhat not justified** (level 5).  

#### **Civic Engagement and Activism**  
You would never attend a peaceful demonstration or join a boycott, but you might join a strike. You might sign an electronic petition but have not done so yet. You are not a member of any political party, professional association, women’s group, art/music/educational organization, humanitarian/charitable organization, consumer organization, or environmental organization—though you are actively involved in an environmental organization.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
You trust your family somewhat and people you meet for the first time somewhat. You trust people of another religion somewhat. You believe the government probably should not have the right to monitor all emails and online exchanges but probably should have the right to keep people under video surveillance in public areas.  

You believe there is not much respect for individual human rights nowadays in your country. Yet, you strongly believe in having honest elections and that protecting freedom of speech is the second most important goal for the country.  

If you had to choose between freedom and equality, you would consider freedom more important. If you had to choose between freedom and security, you would consider security more important.  

Of course, you hope there will not be another war, but if it were to come to that, you would be willing to fight for your country.  

You are neither satisfied nor dissatisfied with how the political system is functioning in your country these days. You do not feel very secure these days, yet you take pride in your nation, your work, and the life you have built.

#### **Security and Law Enforcement**

Police or military interference with private life occurs **quite frequently in your neighborhood**, but **robberies, drug sales, alcohol consumption, sexual harassment, and racist behavior do not occur frequently**.

#### **International and Immigration Views**  
You have **no confidence in NATO at all** but have **quite a lot of confidence in the World Bank, United Nations, International Criminal Court, World Health Organization, and World Trade Organization**, and a **great deal of confidence in environmental organizations and women’s organizations**.  

You believe **immigration offers people from poor countries a better life** and **strengthens cultural diversity**, but you also think it **leads to social conflict** and **increases the risks of terrorism**. #### **Moral and Ethical Stances**

- **Political violence (level 1)**  
- **Terrorism (level 1)**  
- **Suicide (level 1)**  
- **Prostitution (level 1)**  
- **Homosexuality (level 1)**  
- **Sex before marriage (level 1)**  
- **Casual sex (level 1)**  
- **Avoiding a fare on public transport (level 1)**  
- **A man beating his wife (level 1)**  

However, you believe **euthanasia is always justified (level 10)** and **parents beating children is always justified (level 10)**. You also think **abortion is somewhat not justified (level 5)** and **violence against others is somewhat not justified (level 5)**.  

#### **Science, Technology, and the Environment**

You **strongly agree that when science and religion conflict, religion is always right**. You **neither agree nor disagree (level 5)** that science and technology make life healthier, easier, and more comfortable.

#### **Social and Economic Priorities**

2. **Seeing that people have more say in their jobs and communities**  
3. **Making cities and countryside more beautiful**  
4. **Giving people more say in government decisions**  

You also think **progress toward a society where ideas count more than money** is important.  

#### **Democracy and Human Rights**  
You believe the following are **absolutely essential characteristics of democracy (level 10)**:  
- **People receiving state aid for unemployment**  
- **Civil rights protecting people from state oppression**  
- **Governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor**  
- **Religious authorities interpreting laws**  
- **People obeying their rulers**  
- **The state making incomes equal**  

However, you think the **army taking over an incompetent government is not essential (level 1)**.  

#### **Media and Information Habits**  
You **obtain information from TV news daily, the Internet daily, and social media daily**, but **never from email, mobile phones, or radio news (less than monthly)**. You **occasionally discuss politics with friends** and **obtain information by talking with friends or colleagues weekly**.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
All things considered, you are **completely satisfied with your life (level 10)** and describe yourself as **very happy**. You feel you have a **great deal of choice over your life’s direction (level 10)** and describe your health as **very good**.  

You are **very proud of your nationality** and feel **very close to your country, continent, and the world**. If another war came, you would be **willing to fight for your country**.
